intro: Cacalia thwaitesii, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, and it blooms from late winter to early spring. Cacalia thwaitesii is a relatively small plant, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
